title: Ticket #3169: Dead code
description:
From Florian Weimer -

The GIVE_REQUEST_AD handler is registered this way: 

	daemonCore->Register_Command( GIVE_REQUEST_AD, "GIVE_REQUEST_AD",
           (CommandHandler)command_give_request_ad,
            "command_give_request_ad", 0, READ );

As a result, unauthenticated users which can connect to the startd TCP port can request ads provided that they can guess/brute force the PID. These ads appear to contain private data: 

...
ClaimId = "<10.16.64.137:49232>#1341223853#4973#11e3494f462184c5b5d85b97dd9fc33d42d587a8"
...
remarks:
2012-Jul-30 16:23:07 by jfrey:
I don't see anywhere the starter (or anything else) uses GIVE_REQUEST_AD.

2012-Jul-30 16:39:22 by jfrey:
Hence the ticket title. I should learn to read everything before I comment.

2012-Jul-31 14:31:39 by jfrey:
CODE REVIEW

I reviewed the patch 0008-Remove-unused-GIVE_REQUEST_AD-command-from-the-start.patch forwarded by Matt. It looks good.
check_ins:
2012-Sep-17 19:45   Check-in [33391]: Remove unused GIVE_REQUEST_AD command from the startd, #3169 Note: dos2unix was run on command.h for a clean cherry-pick from master Signed-off-by: Jaime Frey <jfrey@cs.wisc.edu> (By Matthew Farrellee )
2012-Sep-13 12:43   Check-in [33359]: Remove unused GIVE_REQUEST_AD command from the startd, #3169 Signed-off-by: Jaime Frey <jfrey@cs.wisc.edu> (By Matthew Farrellee )
creator: matt
